artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Maruya Jinpachi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 21; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 305.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two standing women at shoreline; woman at left wears kimono with red at top shading into blue and bottom, with yellow and blue flowers, and holds a staff and a black umbrella; woman at right wears a blue kimono with black trim and a purple belt; trees in background
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Censor seal: 申五改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Syllabary Copybook of the Treasury of Loyal Retainers (Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
text: Actors Onoe Kikugorō IV as Tonase (R) and Bandō Tamasaburō II as Konami (L). Related to the play Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵, performed at the Nakamura Theater in the 4th month of 1860.
title: Eighth Act
